ygData.subject: Re: Will not sufficient??
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Probably not high 100s for a dark elf. ... Demon Claws have a base damage of 5, and they are a little low level for level 30 rangers. And I must also ...
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Howard Chan" <hchan@...>
>Reply-To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com
>To: <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eq_shadowknights] Will not sufficient??
>Date: Wed, 16 Jun 1999 04:19:02 -0600
>
>From: "Howard Chan" <hchan@...>
>
> >if you were level 40 with the dark reaver, THE LEVEL YOU SHOULD BE! then
>you
> >would be doing damage in the high 100s.

Probably not high 100s for a dark elf.

>Wow! I have never seen anyone doing over 100 before. Hmm, I must be blinded
>when I see high 30 Rangers doing 17 with their Demon Claws.

Demon Claws have a base damage of 5, and they are a little low level for
level 30 rangers.

And I must also
>be mistaken when I see a level 40+ doing an average of 60 with the Reaver.

Thats a pretty damn bad level 40+ person there. Probably a dark elf :P

>But that is okay, because they could be doing high 100s in your own world.
>High 100s, eh? Why not 9999 damage as seen in Final Fantasy games?

Oh, sorry, I thought this was final-fantasyquest XVI

>I would like to quote you on something, "I know that a level 20 warrior
>with
>the executioners axe can do 100 damage". First, you condemn me for having
>the Dark Reaver at my level, then you go on to state that a level **20**

Ok, I am not saying I agree with this guys having the weapon, or admire his
ability to somehow buy the executioners axe. Just that I have seen it.

>WITH an **Executioner's Axe** can do **over 100**?? . . . I am not sure
>myself, but I think I see something wrong with that. Quite obviously, you
>are UNCERTAIN of your position of your argument. In addition, you give
>evidence that is completely FALSE. A level 20 with an Executioner's Axe, is
>a 'cheap bastard' as you would have called it, because there is no way he
>could have obtained it himself (unless he bought it). Also, I have yet to
>see a level 40+ with an Executioner's Axe that can do over 80; stating
>'over
>100' at level 20 already proves that you are pulling numbers out of a hat.

Have you ever fought the guards in freeport? The captain that is? He is
around level 40 and a warrior, he KICKS for 120 damage. Now npcs warriors
like that have around the same stats as pc characters of he same level.
Just goes to show your ineptitude.


>It is very interesting to see how people react to others who get higher
>level equipment. Those people believe that unless you camped for the item,
>you are not allowed to use it even if you have enough money to afford it.
>Perhaps when you have collected enough snake fangs to get your Mino Axe, I
>should call you a 'cheap bastard' and condemn you for having equipment that
>is out of your league. Just like what you did to me.

I don't use 1h slashing :P

>Think about the following: IF I was a level 1 walking in Full Plate, why
>would you care??

Yes, I have seen it happen, and I despise the people that do it. But only
twinkers, not people that have equipment given to them by someone who is
leaving the game or something.

So, what if I have an advantage over you - does that affect
>your game play in any way? Or is it that you are so jealous of my
>equipment,
>that you must condemn me for what I have?
>
>- Level 1 Shadow Knight who is surviving 70 damage blows from spectres.


Just to clear things up why don't you give your level, strength and 2h
slashing skill?


- A person who let his EQ account run out because he was tired of the
game due to playing it since december in phase 3.
